original_title: Sri Lanka’s Aswesuma beneficiaries list yet to be finalised: state minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – A list of beneficiaries for Sri Lanka’s new Aswesuma welfare programme has yet to be finalised and will be published after evaluating appeals and objections, State Minister of Finance Shehan Semasinghe said.

Semasinghe, who is serving as Acting Finance Minister during President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s ongoing visit to France, tweeted Saturday June 24 afternoon that appeals and objections received by government agents and assistant government agents will be evaluated and, in the event further injustice is found, the Welfare Benefits Board (WBB) will intervene.

“Different surveys have shown around 30 percent of welfare benefits are received by people who don’t qualify to receive [the welfare assistance], and the new survey is a transparent, non-politically influenced programme designed to provide additional benefits to the poor,” the state minister said.
“The beneficiary list for low-income senior citizens , kidney patients and differently-abled will be published next week,” he said.
Protests were reported on Friday held by welfare beneficiaries against alleged injustice in the evaluation process.
A number of opposition legislators on Friday criticised the government over the matter.

On May 12, Sri Lanka’s parliament approved a new welfare benefit plan which would consolidate existing social welfare schemes and allow beneficiaries to enter and exit depending on changing incomes. The proposal was approved by the parliament without a vote.
Sri Lanka’s poor has surged by 4 million to 7 million since 2019 to 31 percent of the population in 2023, a recent survey by LIRNEasia showed.
